items.title: Arsenal in luxepositie op weg naar titel: 'Zitten pas in januari'
items.summary: Mikel Arteta (43) is een tevreden manager bij Arsenal. De Spanjaard bouwde een comfortabele voorsprong op in de strijd om de Premier League-titel en zag de concurrentie op nieuwjaarsdag punten morsen. Al wil de oefenmeester zich nog niet rijk rekenen.

items.title: Africa Cup of Nations: tie-by-tie analysis of the last-16 matches
items.summary: After a group stage that delivered an average of 3.6 goals a game we look at the match-ups in Morocco that start on Saturday Senegal, winners of the Afcon in 2022, have arguably the best collection of players, including the experience of Sadio Man√© and the explosive talent of Nicolas Jackson, and are superior to their east African opponents. But Sudan, who qualified for the tournament despite the tragedy of a horrendous war in their country, certainly match the Lions of Teranga in fortitude. Sudan, coached by the Ghanaian Kwesi Appiah, who led his home country at the 2014 World Cup in Brazil, played all their qualifiers away from home, with the war, which began in April 2023, shutting down a thriving domestic league. The Sudan striker John Mano told the BBC: ‚ÄúSome of them [people in Sudan] cannot watch the matches ‚Ä¶ They can‚Äôt even listen on the radio ‚Ä¶ We are trying to free our country, through the football way.‚Äù An win for Sudan would be one of the fairytales of the tournament. Continue reading...

items.title: Chelsea manager latest, transfer updates and more: football news ‚Äì live
items.summary: ‚öΩ Read Jacob Steinberg on Maresca‚Äôs Chelsea departure ‚öΩ Fixtures | Tables | Follow us on Bluesky | Email Tom Eddie Howe is having none of the idea that Newcastle have no plan B, reports PA Media, and rejected suggestions they were under the cosh in their win at Burnley. Howe bristled at suggestions they had come under an onslaught at Turf Moor and there was nothing they could do about it. He said: ‚ÄúAn onslaught? What, against us? Have you seen the stats of the game? You must have been watching a different game then. There was no onslaught. ‚ÄúYes, we had moments, of course. We had moments the other way. I would never describe it as that. If it was an onslaught, I‚Äôd give you my opinion and say, ‚ÄòYes, I thought it was‚Äô. Continue reading...

items.title: Feyenoord-aanvaller Diarra verlaat Afrika Cup met blessure
items.summary: Voor Feyenoord-aanvaller Gaoussou Diarra zit de Afrika Cup erop. De buitenspeler liep een enkelblessure op de training op en is de rest van het toernooi niet meer inzetbaar voor Mali.

items.summary: Both transfers being driven by Nuno Esp√≠rito Santo Sterling rejects West Ham, with Fulham favourites West Ham are poised to boost their attacking options by signing Gil Vicente‚Äôs Pablo Felipe and Lazio‚Äôs Taty Castellanos at a cost of up to ¬£47m. Both deals have been driven by Nuno Esp√≠rito Santo, who is looking to help his struggling side‚Äôs fight to stay in the Premier League by adding more firepower. West Ham considered a move for the Wolves striker J√∏rgen Strand Larsen but decided against making a bid after concluding that his ¬£40m valuation was too high. Continue reading...

items.title: Van Persie neemt deze acht jeugdspelers mee op trainingskamp in Spanje
items.summary: Feyenoord begint vrijdag aan de voorbereiding op de tweede seizoenshelft. De Rotterdammers vliegen naar Marbella, waar een trainingskamp belegd wordt. Trainer Robin van Persie neemt acht jeugdspelers mee naar Spanje.

items.title: Sources: Rosenior frontrunner to replace Maresca
items.summary: Strasbourg boss Liam Rosenior is the leading candidate to succeed Enzo Maresca as Chelsea head coach, sources have told ESPN.

items.title: Pep says Rodri 'changed the game' in City return
items.summary: Pep Guardiola said Rodri showed Manchester City what they have been missing for a year and a half after the Ballon d'Or winner's substitute performance during a goalless draw at Sunderland.

items.title: Liverpool disappointed as unbeaten run goes to 8
items.summary: Arne Slot described Liverpool's 0-0 draw with Leeds United as a "disappointment" despite his team extending their unbeaten run to eight games in all competitions.

items.title: City lose ground to Arsenal with Sunderland draw
items.summary: Sunderland extended their unbeaten Premier League home record to 10 games after holding Manchester City to a goalless draw.

items.title: Is Gyokeres struggling to adapt or being misused?
items.summary: Viktor Gyokeres joined Arsenal as Europe's most prolific goalscorer - so why have his numbers dropped so drastically?

items.title: Waarom AZ het gokje aandurft met Ayoub Oufkir
items.summary: Terwijl Kees Smit, het huidige pareltje in de AZ-selectie, op de interesse mag rekenen van zowat de gehele wereldtop, hopen de Alkmaarders in 2026 een nieuwe parel te hebben gevonden. Ayoub Oufkir (19), die zich afgelopen zomer nog samen met Smit tot Europees kampioen mocht kronen bij Oranje Onder-19, maakt voor naar verluidt zo'n 5 miljoen euro de overstap van Sparta. VI PRO bekeek daarom alle speelminuten van Oufkir in 2025/26 nogmaals terug, om het spel van de talentvolle linkspoot te beoordelen. Video-analyse van een buitenspeler met geweldige voorwaarden, maar duidelijke verbeterpunten.

items.title: Venus Williams, 45, receives wildcard entry for Australian Open
items.summary: Venus Williams will return to the Australian ‚ÄåOpen after receiving a wildcard entry, the tournament's organisers said ‚Äãon Friday, marking her first appearance at Melbourne ‚Å†Park in five years.

items.title: 'It's an easy decision' | Did Romero escape a red card?
items.summary: On Ref Watch, Dermot Gallagher gives his verdict on whether Cristian Romero escaped a red card for a foul on Brentford's' Igor Thiago.

items.title: WSL latest: London City Lionesses appoint Maestre as head coach
McIlroy: Ryder Cup crowd worst I've ever known - 'Bradley could have done more'
items.summary: Rory McIlroy said the Ryder Cup crowd at Bethpage Black was "by far the worst" he has experienced, saying USA captain Keegan Bradley "could have done more".

items.title: The Guardian Footballer of the Year Jess Carter: ‚ÄòI remember not wanting to go out‚Äô
items.summary: England defender publicly confronted racist abuse at the Euros and ended 2025 a title winner with club and country The Guardian Footballer of the Year is an award given to a player who has done something remarkable, whether by overcoming adversity, helping others or setting a sporting example by acting with exceptional honesty. Jess Carter has spent her life grappling with when to hold back and when to speak up; wrestling with being naturally herself, embodying the characteristics her parents instilled in her of being open, honest, vocal and confident, and subduing herself because, while society values those traits, in a black woman they can be viewed negatively. Continue reading...

items.title: 'Best bargain' Kamara at heart of Aston Villa success
items.summary: Boubacar Kamara is Aston Villa's unassuming star and has quietly evolved into one of the best midfielders in the Premier League.

items.title: 'We are not happy' - Man City fall behind Arsenal in title race
items.summary: Pep Guardiola questioned whether it was only a two-horse Premier League title race, but his Manchester City side can ill-afford many slip-ups in their quest to hunt down leaders Arsenal.
